keyTakeAways: Lance Bass has type 1.5 diabetes, also known as latent autoimmune diabetes (LADA).
Bass uses the Dexcom G7 Continuous Glucose Monitoring System to track his blood sugar levels.
He created an online persona called 'Blood Sugar Lance' to educate the public about diabetes with humor, which developed accidentally.
He identifies white rice and white bread as foods that significantly spike his blood sugar, even with minimal intake.
Before modern monitoring tools, Bass struggled to manage his diabetes due to frequent missed tests and lack of real-time data.
His uncle had type 1 diabetes, which influenced his early awareness of the condition.
Advancements in diabetes technology and community support have improved his daily management and quality of life.
Stress from his high-profile career and role as a father to twin children impacts his blood sugar levels.
Lance Bass has no current plans for an *NSYNC reunion tour, stating he has 'no news' and is skeptical of sensationalized media reports.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Lance Bass, former member of *NSYNC, shares insights into his life living with type 1.5 diabetes (LADA), emphasizing how modern technology like the Dexcom G7 system has transformed his management of the condition. He created the humorous online persona 'Blood Sugar Lance' to educate the public and reduce stigma. Bass highlights how foods like white rice and white bread cause dangerous blood sugar spikes, and how stress from his career and parenting of twin children affects his health. While fans are eager for a possible *NSYNC reunion, Bass confirms there is no current plan, and he dismisses sensationalized media claims. His experience underscores the importance of technology, community support, and personal awareness in managing diabetes.
title: Lance Bass has more to say about living with diabetes than he does about an *NSYNC reunion
